description.narrative: In 2021, COVID 19 and the Military Coup impacted significantly on the lives of people in Myanmar. In this regard, FLO had to adapt their ways of working and approaches to meet the needs of people in the ground. For this new phase of work they will focus on 3 main-components that contribute to overcome the crisis and build resilience for the communities. 1. supporting and sharing to contribute to resilience and regenerative works. Under the resilience and regenerative component FLO will do some trainings to foster community mobilization and support seed grants for alumni to be able to initiate actions that promote resilience in their communities. In this approach, FLO aims to support to community mobilizers who are active, understand the local context and analysis and connect and build on local collaboration. 2. Engaging Spiritual and Eco-friendly Education for teachers. For the current situation in this crisis the teachers need to know the Environmental Education based on holistic view. They can be apply the right livelihood-based happiness of economic and the localization living style for the current situation and the rehabilitation. Through this approach they will also learn to cope with stress, depression and trauma, which can be also shared to community members. 3. Emergency Response in our Alumni Areas. We will support for emergency cases for specific essential needs such as as food crisis or COVID 19.
